A

add(Monom) - Method in class Monom
when monom have the same power so we add the coefficient to the other coefficient this condition should always be true if the polynom class was built correctly
add(Polynom_able) - Method in class Polynom
The add polynom function gets a given polynom and the polynom we have and adds them together
add(Monom) - Method in class Polynom
the add monom function gets a given monom and adds it to the polynom of course if that monom already exists it just adds the coefficient to the given monom and if the sum of the coefficient is 0 so it removes it from the array
add(Polynom_able) - Method in interface Polynom_able
Add p1 to this Polynom
add(Monom) - Method in interface Polynom_able
Add m1 to this Polynom
area(double, double, double) - Method in interface cont_function
Compute a Riman's integral from x0 to x1 in eps steps.
area(double, double, double) - Method in class Polynom
the area function uses Riemann's Integral to calculate the area in this function we only calculate the area of the graph above the x line sumOfArea is the current sum of area being calculated
area(double, double, double) - Method in interface Polynom_able
Compute Riemann's Integral over this Polynom starting from x0, till x1 using eps size steps, see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riemann_integral
areaUnder(String, double, double, double) - Static method in class Main
This function calculates the area below the x line given a start point and end point and step size aand the string of the polynom
